TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DatabaseMetaData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: An interface which provides comprehensive information about the database management system and its supported features.

remarks.para: An interface which provides comprehensive information about the database management system and its supported features.
This interface is implemented by JDBC driver vendors in order to provide information about the underlying database capabilities in association with the JDBC driver.

Some of the methods in this interface take string parameters which are patterns. Within these string patterns, '%' and '_' characters have special meanings. '%' means "match any substring of 0 or more characters". '_' means "match any character". Only metadata entries that match the pattern are returned. If such a search pattern string is set to null, that argument's criteria are dropped from the search.

Docs.summary: For the column UPDATE_RULE, states that when the primary key is updated, the foreign key (imported key) is changed accordingly.

remarks.para: For the column UPDATE_RULE, states that when the primary key is updated, the foreign key (imported key) is changed accordingly.

Docs.summary: States that the evaluation of foreign key constraints is deferred (delayed until commit).

remarks.para: States that the evaluation of foreign key constraints is deferred (delayed until commit).

Docs.summary: States that the evaluation of foreign key constraint is IMMEDIATE .

remarks.para: States that the evaluation of foreign key constraint is IMMEDIATE .

Docs.summary: For the columns UPDATE_RULE and DELETE_RULE, states that if the primary key has been imported, it cannot be updated or deleted.

remarks.para: For the columns UPDATE_RULE and DELETE_RULE, states that if the primary key has been imported, it cannot be updated or deleted.

Docs.summary: States that the evaluation of foreign key constraint must not be DEFERRED.

remarks.para: States that the evaluation of foreign key constraint must not be DEFERRED.

Docs.summary: States that a primary key must not be updated when imported as a foreign key by some other table.

remarks.para: States that a primary key must not be updated when imported as a foreign key by some other table. Used for the column UPDATE_RULE.

Docs.summary: States that when the primary key is modified (updated or deleted) the foreign (imported) key is changed to its default value.

remarks.para: States that when the primary key is modified (updated or deleted) the foreign (imported) key is changed to its default value. Applies to the UPDATE_RULE and DELETE_RULE columns.

Docs.summary: States that when the primary key is modified (updated or deleted) the foreign (imported) key is changed to NULL.

remarks.para: States that when the primary key is modified (updated or deleted) the foreign (imported) key is changed to NULL. Applies to the UPDATE_RULE and DELETE_RULE columns.
